page.title: 14Media(Survey)
page.content:
{NEWSPAPERS:}In our sample 89% read a newspaper daily; of these, the most popular papers included the Sun, the Mirror and the Star. Higher quality papers such as the Guardian and the Times were less popular. 25% of the people prefered to read a local paper eg. Leicester Mercury. {TELEVISION:}Although 39% of the sample had no preference to which channel they watched, the most popular channels proved to be ITV and BBC1. On the whole most people enjoyed watching a wide variety of programmes.
50% of the sample felt that the media was biased in it's presentation of the news; the other 50% thought that the media did not distort the truth. { { {
